bibl.title: Letter from James Carroll Flippen to Jefferson Randolph Kean, March 2, 1938

div1.p: Flippen asks Kean if he would be able to provide him with information about Walter Reed. [Courtesy of The Albert and Shirley Small Special Collections Library, University of Virginia Library]

div1.head: Letter from James Carroll Flippen to Jefferson Randolph Kean, March 2, 1938
div1.opener:
UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA
DEPARTMENT OF MEDICINE
CHARLOTTESVILLE
OFFICE OF THE DEAN
March 2, 1938.
Col. J. Randolph Kean,
2804 N Street, N. W.,
Washington, D. C.
Dear Col. Kean:
div1.p:
Recently I have been interested in re-
viewing the life of Walter Reed and certain ques-
tions have come up in my mind, the answers to which
I have not been able to find in available litera-
ture.

I am wondering if you will be good enough
to go over these items and let me know whether you
have knowledge of them. I am writing this prelim-
inary note, so as not to burden you with a longer
communication in case circumstances are such that you
do not feel that you would care to give the matter
further consideration.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, J. C. Flippin J. C. Flippin, Dean.
JCF:FS.
